thread.title: Coronation Street set CLOSES as Storm Dorris gives cast an early finish
thread.title_full: Coronation Street set CLOSES as Storm Dorris gives cast an early finish

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Coronation Street set CLOSES as Storm Dorris gives cast an early finish
text:
Coronation Street set CLOSES as Storm Dorris gives cast an early finish Winds of 80mph battered the streets of Manchester on Wednesday, causing a halt to filming Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Coronation Street set has been closed down after Storm Doris battered the city of Manchester. 
Filming for the long-running soap has been thrown into chaos after winds of up to 80mph hit the UK on Thursday from across the Atlantic. 
After an hour or so of persevering through the strong gales and heavy rain, producers made the wise decision to pull the plug on rehearsals until they can resume tomorrow - which went down well with some of the cast. Filming has been halted after the storm hit Manchester 
Samia Longchambon, who plays Maria Connor, was thrilled that she could spend the rest of the day cuddled up on the sofa. Read More 
The brunette beauty - who has children Freya, eight, and 17-month-old son Yves - wrote on Twitter: "#stormdoris putting a stop to cobble filming @itvcorrie this morning. Back home for snugs, sofa n a film with my monkeys (sic)." Samia was happy to head home (Photo: PA) Dolly-Rose gave her fans some advice (Photo: ITV) 
And she wasn't the only one who dashed back home to hide from the strong winds and heavy rain. 
Dolly-Rose Campbell - who plays mouthy kebab shop worker Gemma on the soap - gave her fans some advice as they wait for the storm to pass. 
The soap star wrote: "#stormdorris batten down the hatches and drink plenty of tea! (sic)" Like us on Facebook
